citation.article-title: Gallaecimonas pentaromativorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterium carrying 16S rRNA gene heterogeneity and able to degrade high-molecular-mass polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Gallaecimonas (Gal.la.e.ci.mo′nas. L. n. Gallaecia of Galicia, a region of north-west Spain; L. fem. n. monas a monad, unit; N.L. fem. n. Gallaecimonas single microbe isolated from Galicia).
Major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and C18 : 1ω7c.
Minor fatty acids are C14 : 0, C12 : 0 3-OH, C18 : 0, C12 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, C17 : 0, C17 : 1ω7c, C10 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0, C18 : 2ω6c and C18 : 1ω9c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 41.7 mol%.
The type species is Gallaecimonas pentaromativorans.
